etymologies: mid 16th century: the plants so named because of remaining green in winter, suggested by Dutch wintergroen, German Wintergrün

definitions: a pungent oil containing methyl salicylate, now obtained chiefly from the sweet birch or made synthetically, used medicinally and as a flavoring.
a North American plant from which a pungent oil is obtained, in particular the checkerberry or related shrubs.
shortDefinitions: birch tree whose bark produces oil

definitions: a low-growing plant of acid soils in north temperate regions, with spikes of white bell-shaped flowers.

notes.text: Chimaphila, Pyrola and other genera, family Pyrolaceae (the wintergreen family): several species, including the spotted wintergreen (C. maculata)

shortDefinitions: low-growing plant of acid soils in north temperate regions, with spikes of white bell-shaped flowers
